item.title: Anthropic Is Trying to Win the AI Race Without Losing Its Soul
item.description: Dario Amodei has transformed himself from an academic into the CEO of a $61 billion startup.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Anthropic co-founder and CEO Dario Amodei at the startup’s offices in San Francisco.

item.title: Vodacom Eyes Africa Network Sharing as Payout Beats Forecast
item.description: Vodacom Group Ltd., Africa’s largest wireless carrier, declared a full-year dividend that beat analysts’ estimates and outlined plans for network sharing agreements across the region.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: A Vodacom Group store in Pretoria, South Africa.

item.title: Nvidia Opens AI Ecosystem to Rival Chipmakers to Aid Global Push
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang outlined plans to let customers deploy rivals’ chips in data centers built around its technology, a move that acknowledges the growth of in-house semiconductor development by major clients from Microsoft Corp. to Amazon.com Inc.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Ian King, Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang at Computex in Taipei on May 19. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Xiaomi Aims to Spend $7 Billion on Building Own Chip This Decade
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. is planning to invest at least 50 billion yuan ($6.9 billion) in developing its own mobile processor over a decade to grow its semiconductor clout, as major tech companies increasingly treat chip knowhow as strategically important.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

item.title: Revolut Plans to Invest €1 Billion in France, Apply for License
item.description: Revolut Ltd., Europe’s largest digital bank, plans to invest more than €1 billion ($1.1 billion) in France and apply for a local banking license as the fintech eyes an expansion across Europe.
item.dc:creator: Aisha S Gani, Claudia Cohen

item.title: Alibaba Shares Slide as AI Deal With Apple Faces US Scrutiny
item.description: Shares of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. slumped after a report that the Trump administration has raised concerns over Apple Inc.’s potential deal with the Chinese technology firm.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Richest Thai Man Raises Top Bank’s Stake to Be No. 3 Shareholder
item.description: Gulf Development Pcl, controlled by Thailand’s richest man Sarath Ratanavadi, has raised its stake in Kasikornbank Pcl to about $610 million, making it the commercial lender’s third-largest shareholder.
item.dc:creator: Anuchit Nguyen

item.title: Baidu, Bilibili, Lenovo Report as US-China Trade Tensions Ease
item.description: Baidu Inc., Bilibili Inc. and Lenovo Group Ltd. are among the Chinese tech firms in focus for this week’s earnings, just as the easing US-China trade war brings back some optimism for the sector.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan, Reina Sasaki

media:content.media:description: A screen demonstrates a Taichi learning software utilizing AI and motion capture technology during the Baidu Inc. Create AI Developer Conference in Wuhan, China, on Friday, April 25, 2025. Baidu unveiled upgrades to its flagship AI models and slashed their prices as it looks to take on rivals like Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and DeepSeek in China's increasingly competitive artificial intelligence market.

item.title: Chinese Luxury Carmaker Seres Comes From Behind to Overtake BMW
item.description: In under four years, Seres Group Co., a small Chinese automaker once best known for its 30,000 yuan ($4,200) minivans, has beaten luxury legacy names like BMW and Mercedes to become the nation’s hottest high-end car seller.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew

item.title: Cybersecurity Firm Cyera Valued at $6 Billion in Funding Round
item.description: Data security business Cyera is set to be valued at $6 billion in a new investment round, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: binary code on dark background Photographer: loops7/E+

item.title: Why Apple Still Hasn’t Cracked AI
item.description: Insiders say continued failure to get artificial intelligence right threatens everything from the iPhone’s dominance to plans for robots and other futuristic products.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Drake Bennett

item.title: Crypto High-Rollers Go Big on Bodyguards to Deter Kidnappers
item.description: Even before Coinbase Global Inc. disclosed that hackers had stolen the home addresses and account balances of its customers, Jethro Pijlman was seeing an uptick in interest from concerned clients with large crypto holdings who were looking for bodyguards and other forms of protection.
item.dc:creator: Emily Nicolle

media:content.media:description: A collection of bitcoin, litecoin and ethereum tokens sit in this arranged photograph in Danbury, U.K., on Tuesday, Oct. 17, 2017. On Wednesday, billionaire Warren Buffett said on CNBC that most digital coins won't hold their value.

item.title: Beyond Nvidia, Four Things to Know at Asia’s Biggest Tech Show
item.description: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang headlines the 2025 edition of Asia’s biggest electronics conference, for years a showcase for his company’s cutting-edge AI chips and the companies lining up to buy them. This year, however, the spotlight may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Jane Lanhee Lee
